text: Freddie King (September 3, 1934 â€“ December 28, 1976) was an American blues guitarist and singer. He recorded many hits for Federal Records in the early 1960s. He was added into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2012. King was born in Gilmer, Texas. King based his guitar style on Texas blues and Chicago blues. His best-known recordings include the early instrumentals "Hide Away" (1961), "San-Ho-Zay," (1961) and "The Stumble" (1962). He later became involved with more rhythm and blues- and rock-oriented producers. King died on December 28, 1976 in Dallas, Texas from pancreatitis, at the age of 42. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:1976 deaths Category:Deaths from pancreatitis Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American rock guitarists Category:American R&B; musicians Category:American R&B; singers Category:American rock singers Category:American blues singers Category:American blues musicians Category:Singers from Texas Category:Musicians from Texas Category:Writers from Texas
title: Freddie King
